repnme.cdata!:
Russia - Fiscal Federalism & Regional
            Fiscal Reform Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fiscal Federalism & Regional
            Fiscal Reform Project had a satisfactory outcome, likely
            sustainability, substantial institutional development
            impact, and satisfactory performances by both Bank and
            Borrower.  There are four main lessons from this operation:
            1. The competitive model of promoting reform can be
            effective. 2. Technical assistance is more effective when it
            is reinforced by an incentive framework. 3. Ownership
            matters. 4. Subnational fiscal reform can be a legitimate
            topic for policy lending.

docna.cdata!:
Russia - Fiscal Federalism & Regional
            Fiscal Reform Project

Russia - Fiscal Federalism &
            Regional Fiscal Reform Project

TF036345-RUSSIA - LEGAL INSTI-DEBT MGMT.,TF037109-RUSSIAN FED - LEGAL

repnme.cdata!:
Russia - Fiscal Federalism and Regional
            Fiscal Reform Loan Project : release of the second tranche -
            full compliance

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fiscal Federalism and Regional
            Fiscal Reform Loan Project was approved on January 29, 2002,
            partially disbursed in two installments, and the front-end
            fee withdrawn on June, 2002. The remaining amount is to be
            disbursed in two equal tranches, a second tranche released
            in 2003, and a third tranche expected to be released in
            2004. The conditions for this second tranche consist of full
            compliance with specific tranche conditions, on-track
            implementation of the reform program, and satisfactory
            macroeconomic performance, which have now been fulfilled.
            The six conditions which have been met are: a) the continued
            project operation in accordance with agreed procedures; b)
            adoption of the Law on the Federal Budget for 2003 for
            funding of the project; c) presentation of applications and
            reform programs to the Ministry of Finance for evaluation,
            by regions for second and third cohorts; d) satisfactory
            progress in the implementation of the second stage of fiscal
            reform programs in at least one region belonging to the
            first cohort, consistent with project procedures; e)
            satisfactory progress in implementation of fiscal reform
            programs in at least one region belonging to the second
            cohort, consistent with project procedures; and, f) project
            disbursements to regions, made according to agreed
            procedures, and timetable.

1552102.trustfund:
TF037109-RUSSIAN FED - LEGAL
            INSTITUTIONAL, DEBT MANAGEMENT,TF036345-RUSSIA - LEGAL INSTI-DEBT MGMT.

repnme.cdata!:
Russian Federation - Fiscal Federalism
            & Regional Fiscal Reform Loan Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Fiscal Federalism & Regional
            Fiscal Reform Loan (FFRFRL) aims to support the regions of
            the Russian Federation in developing and implementing fiscal
            reform programs that will promote financial transparency,
            budgetary accountability, and strenghtened fiscal management
            policies and practices at the regional level. It is
            undertaken in the context of recent improvements in the
            framework for fiscal federalism in Russia. The adjustment
            loam provides financing to the Federal Budget to support a
            broad range og reforms. The government will create a
            Regional Fiscal Reform Fund (RFRF), a separate transfer
            mechanism in the Federal budget, specifically to reward, on
            a competitive basis, regions that have undertaken
            significant fiscal reforms. Operation of the RFRF will be
            governed by procedures agreed between the Bank and the
            Government, including the process and timing of disbursement
            to regional budgets. Three tranches will be released based
            on the accomplishment of agreed upon conditionality. Key
            benefits of the project include improved fiscal management,
            greater budgetary transparency and accountability, more
            effective use of resources, and in the longer term, improved
            service delivery at the regional level of government.
